text: the aftermath of shelling in a Donetsk
suburb more heavy fighting between
pro-russian separatists and Ukrainian
forces Ukraine has long accused Russia
of arming the rebels now questions are
building over who exactly is fighting on
the rebel side this unverified footage
claims to show combats between Ukrainian
forces and militants near the key port
of Mariupol Moscow says the fighters are
pro-russia separatists Kiev says they're
Russian
according to Ukraine a column of 10
tanks and two armored personnel carriers
crossed from Russia into Ukraine and
headed towards Mariupol two tanks were
destroyed and the area was blocked by
Ukrainian troops it also says that
security forces captured ten Russian
soldiers near the village of circle the
US National Security Advisor Susan Rice
said on Twitter repeated Russian
incursions into Ukraine unacceptable
dangerous and inflammatory they
represent significant escalation it's
not just the east of the country that's
unstable the political landscape in
Ukraine is far from certain - the
president has dissolved Parliament's
yeah we do so the stroke of a prop Anita
I made a decision about the early
termination of the Parliament the
elections for the new Parliament will
take place on the 26th of October the
decision was made according to chapter
90 of the Ukrainian Constitution portion
ko says the move is necessary in part to
remove members who are blocking reform
if the president is unable to end the
fighting in eastern Ukraine before the
October vote he risks a voter backlash
he stood to meet the Russian President
Vladimir Putin in the Belarusian capital
Minsk later to try to end the crisis it
will be the first time the two men have
met since June they found little to
agree on since then Emily Thomas BBC
